pullRequest.body:
This PR does the following
- Renames `Sheaf.IsDiscrete` to `Sheaf.IsConstant`. 
- Renames the file `Sites/Discrete` to `Sites/IsConstant`
- Removes two lemmas which were essentially duplicates of other ones, and simplifies a proof to be able to remove an auxiliary lemma. 

---

I added these lemmas initially because I used them in #14027, but it turns out they're essentially duplicates of other lemmas, now merged into one lemma `constantSheafAdj_counit_w` which is used in this file and in #14027.

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [34887671e1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15985/commits/34887671e13a083d08ebd8045d90959adb3d9cc2)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.DirichletContinuation | 2165 | 0 | -2165 (-100.00%) |
| Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.ZMod | 2164 | 0 | -2164 (-100.00%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.DirichletContinuation`|-2165|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.ZMod`|-2164|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`- Ici_subset_Ici`
`- Iic_subset_Iic`
`- Iio_subset_Iio`
`- Ioi_subset_Ioi`
`- LFunction_dft`
`- LFunction_one_sub`
`- LFunction_residue_one`
`- LFunction_stdAddChar_eq_expZeta`
`- LSeriesSummable_of_one_lt_re`
`- Nat.residueClassesEquiv`
`- Nat.sumByResidueClasses`
`- differentiable_LFunction`
`- differentiable_LFunction_of_sum_zero`
`- term_of_ne_zero'`
`-- LFunction`
`-- LFunction_eq_LSeries`
`-- LFunction_modOne_eq`
`-- differentiableAt_LFunction`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Why not using the name `IsConstant`? Is "discrete" a terminology that is specific to condensed objects?

I guess "discrete" is specific to topological objects such as condensed sets, and `IsConstant` is better for general sheaves (note that the constant sheaf is in general not with this terminology though...). I'll rename it.
I messed up the merge, closing in favour of #16385

pullRequest.title: chore(CategoryTheory/Sites): remove unused lemmas and simplify some proofs in Sites.Discrete

nodes.body: Why not using the name `IsConstant`? Is "discrete" a terminology that is specific to condensed objects?

I guess "discrete" is specific to topological objects such as condensed sets, and `IsConstant` is better for general sheaves (note that the constant sheaf is in general not with this terminology though...). I'll rename it.
I messed up the merge, closing in favour of #16385
